website_summaries.verdict: If you have multiple devices to charge and not a lot to time to waste, you will appreciate this power bank's trio of ports and speedy performance.
pros: Can charge three devices at once, including phones, laptops, MacBooks, and more thanks to its USB-C and 2 USB ports
Recharges quickly too, and can charge most phones 3 or 4 times before needing recharged again
cons: Pricey, and on the heavy side

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Bought one, worked great.. for about a month or two? Doesn't work anymore.. I paid $120 for that thing.. 0 Responses from the company. Makes me wonder why there's a deal for $88 now... buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Tips650

customer_reviews.title: USB Type-C port failed.  **Udate 2nd failed 6 months
customer_reviews.text: USB Type-C port failed after less than a week of use. Looks like metal shielding got caught by cable and crumpled. Cable no longer goes in flush nor charges battery. ** Replacement failed after 6 months of use. Anker does not reset the warranty period with replacements, so I’m screwed if this one fails with the time left on original warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Wil San

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Just within 3 months power bank not working. It is not charging itslef. It has been 3 days since it charging. Still single LED light is blinking. Hope I get replacement.
customer_reviews.author: RoX

customer_reviews.title: This power bank was fine when I first got it
customer_reviews.text: This power bank was fine when I first got it. Charged fast and my phone charged fine. But it stopped working after 6 months. Now it’s not taking a charge. I wouldn’t recommend this product anymore
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Kositsawat

customer_reviews.title: Stops Charging after 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: A friend and I each bought this exact same Anker portable power supply based on these reviews. His stopped charging after 3 weeks, mine stopped charging after 3 months. Now I have an expensive paper weight. I cannot help but question the integrity of the glowing 600+ reviews, because almost all of the one star reviews have the same issue that render, a critical problem that renders this expensive battery pack useless.
customer_reviews.author: Taichi

customer_reviews.title: Very Common Product Issue
customer_reviews.text: So apparently there is a very common issue with the device not charging. I might have charged it 3 or 4 times as the initial battery life while charging my phone was great. Now the powerbank won’t take a charge at all leaving it completely useless. After looking up the issue I’ve found many people have the same problem so it doesn’t seem like the issue is being addressed by Anker. The only good thing is they do have a decent warranty program and I will be receiving a full refund. Still, I wouldn’t waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months and only 5 uses.
customer_reviews.text: My Anker power bank was dead 2 months after purchase and have been used ~5 times. The power bank no longer charges any device or is able to be charged. The wall charger and the cable are good since they can be used to charge my other USB-C devices (macbook pro and Nexus phone). The power level light now stops forever at 5. I found it broken during a trip and was really annoying. When it worked, it charged super faster. However the durability of this expensive product is really questionable. I already sent an email to Anker customer service and let's see what they will respond.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't leave home without it! Great for MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I love this portable charger as it allows me to keep my MacBook Pro charged up on long trips. My only issue is that two units have failed within 8 months. Anker has been great about replacing them under warranty but makes me a little worried it might fail during a trip. I've only used genuine Apple or Anker cables to charge the PowerCore itself or other devices. Both units that failed would not take a charge. I tried using my MacBook Pro charger and the included Anker power adapter as well as different USB-C cables with no luck. Hope the 3rd one is the charm.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! -Updated-
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year later, the PD wall plug no longer works, and the battery has stopped charging or even accepting a USB-C cable. This is due to a common problem with the design, where the coupler shielding inside apparently bends. Do not buy. Update 12/18/18 - contacted support and returned the item under warranty. New unit was delivered and is currently working as expected. Rating updated to three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L.

customer_reviews.title: Only worked once for travel now it's dead and won't charge......1st Anker failure for me...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for travel and it was great the first time. I took it out again to use with my 12" MacBook and charging was intermittent. Now I tried to charge it and it will not even light up. I've tried using different USB-C cables and wall charger without any luck. This is the first time an Anker unit failed me, I've had plenty of Anker products before and I was more than satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Derick1105

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with a USB C chargeable tablet
customer_reviews.text: My fastest Amazon return. You really can't believe all the 5 star ratings. I fully charged this item, and proceeded to plug in my Dell Latitude 5285 to charge. Will not charge at all. I tried a USB to USB C cable from one of the USB ports and I also tried the USB C to USB C port with a USB C to USB C cable. Neither worked. Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: V. Davi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for charging the 2016 MacBook Pro 15". It charges from 0 to 87% in 3.5 hrs. When keeping the screen about a level 4, and turning off turbo boost, this battery can maintain the current charge level in the MacBook Pro. This battery also works great with the Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a little over a year. Through drops and normal wear and tear. Now all of a sudden it won't charge. Not sure if it's the cord or the battery itself. Just flickers the lights but not enough to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Top notch customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one a year ago (Nintendo Switch User) and that battery was fantastic! I traveled all over the place and had not a single issue. +++++++ Update: +++++++ Anker customer service is top notch! My issue was finally resolved and I wanted to personally thank Luciella @Anker for addressing my issues.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Howl

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Juice To Go
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems with the device. My only complaint is with TSA in limiting the the Watt Hours that we can fly with. I use the(se) to extend the operating time on my cell phones when I am away from a charging source. I won't trust "Free" charging stands because of the threat of Malware being placed on my devices. These Anker battery packs are built to a high quality and they work well for me. I have more than one so I'm able to use one all day and let the other charge.
customer_reviews.author: XRX 150 Team Member

customer_reviews.title: Beast Mode
customer_reviews.text: I travel too much due to my job and have used a good dozen portable batteries over the past few years. This one tops them all, hands down. While it's a bit less portable than smaller, less capable chargers out there, you know you need this if you travel with a phone, a tablet, a laptop, a smart watch, and rechargeable earbuds - or any combination thereof. It charges fast and recharges fast. I dinged it a single star for "travel" only because it weighs as much as it does. Still, if you're on the road a lot, best to be prepared, right? This brick will 100% prepare you for whatever you'll be doing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't put out 30w on USBC
customer_reviews.text: Max power on this device is 20v at 1.25amps printed right at the bottom of the battery bank. It doesn't put out the 30w as advertised. Won't charge my laptop because less than 30w won't charge my laptop. Anker said device is working fine. I been charging my laptop on a 30w Wall charger for a long time. This charger only puts out 25w
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable power pack. It will probably meet your needs.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to run this powerpack down. I have yet topl plug in a laptop or multiple devices, but it has charged my phone and kept it charged at 💯 while using multiple programs and it barely dented the battery after a full day of usage. It's probably overkill for just a phone, but I don't doubt that multiple devices can be used and you can share it with other users. I'll have to plug in a bunch of stuff and follow up on this review.
customer_reviews.author: Sarin69

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Power Bank!
customer_reviews.text: A great product from a great company! This may or may not be obvious, but with so much capacity, the trade off is weight. This power bank feels like a tank. Not an issue once you throw it in your bag. Really not an issue at all. Just something to be aware of if you want something with such a capacity. The included wall charger and cable are excellent and Rapid Charges my Pixel 2!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sonnenfeld

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED A CLEARLY USED UNIT
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received had a broken tamper seal, cables were loosely bundled and strewn about inside the box, the battery itself had been fully charged, and the outer shell of the battery was heavily scratched around the ports, indicating it had been used quite a bit. As far as I can tell, it's functioning...but who knows how many times it has been discharged/recharged and if it's lasting as long as it's supposed to? I've been a very loyal and vocal Anker customer for years, and this is extremely disappointing for a $130 battery...
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Was great while it lasted. Bought Dec 2018 and it's now Aug 2019 and now it won't charge to full. Even after being plugged in for 2 days power indicator will not go past 4/10.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Failed after nearly a year...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this battery pack and used it all the time without a problem for almost a year when out of nowhere it stopped charging. But since I was still under warranty I submitted a claim and shipped them my bad battery. It was through the USPS so I just assumed the whole thing would take forever. But to my surprise, I had my brand new replacement in exactly one week (though it could have arrived even sooner without me knowing since I don't check my mailbox every day as I live in a condo development and it's a short walk away).
customer_reviews.author: tambeb

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Currently in pilot training and use this to charge my iPad on flights. Usually by the time we've planned the flight, gone through the brief, and preflighted, my iPad is already at 50%. Works beautifully and charges fast. I can charge the iPad at least 3-4 times without the anker "running out" of juice. It has a nice convenient button to let you know how much charge is left (see pic). It is bigger than I initially thought, (~7x3x1), but comes with a nice mesh carrying case, and isn't too heavy. I just throw it in my backpack and plug in when necessary. Very nice peace of mind knowing I won't lose power in the middle of an approach!
customer_reviews.author: A Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Good, but needs better design and improvement
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t yet had a chance to really try this item out, but here is my initial impression. It seemed to fully charge (from empty) within a few hours. For travel and carrying, it is physically too big and toooooo heavy. Especially if you are older. It seems to be well-constructed ... durable. I don’t like the non-standard charge cable. While this may be the latest thing, I don’t want to have to be sure that I am carrying a specific charge cable for each different device I have. USB-C was supposed to have taken care of that. Apparently, companies aren’t adhering to a universal standard.
customer_reviews.author: DaleBr

customer_reviews.title: Capacity is absolutely amazing and rapid charge is a life saver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this power bank so I would have power anytime I needed it while I traveled to Auckland New Zealand. This power bank can recharge my pixel 3xl almost 5 full times and the rapid charger for the power bank restores it to full capacity in about 4 hours. I was able to keep all my devices and my wife's charged for our 11+ hour long day trips outside of Auckland. It was even able to charge my Sony A6000 so I never had to stop taking photos. This power bank is just shy of the max allowed by airlines so you will not get a better band for your dollar if you want to travel with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Jones

customer_reviews.title: 2 for 2 dead inside 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Unit powers Switch, Mac, etc great. Overall supper pleased with it however 2 for 2 dead inside 1 year. Anker sent replacement for the first one, now the other has the same symptoms - will not charge. Same cable and power supply that works fine on the replacement unit, fails to charge this one even though its still works to power devices. Hopefully i can either get this one replaced, or just get a different model. Such a promising PD any a supper brand to be seeing this kind of failure rate. Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diivious

customer_reviews.title: Keeps failing
customer_reviews.text: I have sent this item in for warranty repair for three times now each time it will work for a little while then stop. Now they are saying it is out of warranty. This has been garbage the whole time and they won't make it right.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goff

customer_reviews.title: No issues charging my devices, charges quickly with included charger.
customer_reviews.text: This battery bank is larger and heavier than those I've had in the past, but with that comes the extra power I occasionally need for my devices. I've had zero issues charging my Pixel 3, LG Tone headphones, and powering a BT speaker (it uses four AA's or has a MicroUSB port on the back). It charges pretty quickly with the included charger (I haven't timed it, but I also haven't managed to completely drain the battery bank either). I don't notice the extra bulk because I store it in my laptop backpack while I'm traveling. Would certainly purchase another, if the need arose.
customer_reviews.author: michrech

customer_reviews.title: For those long road trips.
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for an extra-long bus ride I was taking, to power my phone and Nintendo Switch, just in case I couldn't be near a power outlet. It got me through the trip and the entire weekend after that, plus the ride back without needing a recharge. It also worked for some friends where their own charger was acting up. This thing is huge, sturdy-feeling (all metal), and just keeps on charging. It seems to hold a charge for quite some time too, which is always a good sign of quality. Anker is the top brand in this space for a reason, and this thing really lives up to their reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Ants

customer_reviews.title: Massive yet powerful
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was DOA. It wouldn't charge and would not charge anything. I contacted Anker and they replaced it immediately. A+ customer service. Ideally, it wouldn't have been dead to start with, but the speed and ease with which they handled the RMA means I don't mind. My only complain is the size of this thing. It is massive. I have the 10k and just didn't think how much LARGER this one would be. If you are traveling, be warned, it is large and weighs accordingly. It carries a charge and will provide your power for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Guill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing when it works, but died after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: This power bank is amazing, I can charge while playing my Switch with no problems whatsover. A little heavy to travel around with but for the juice you get I can’t complain much about it. However, it started to not work that well and eventually died after 10 months of using it. The USB-C connector on the power bank got loose after a while and I have to always wiggle it to make sure my Pixel is charged and two days ago the power bank just won’t work anymore no matter what I do.
customer_reviews.author: oxy

customer_reviews.title: Works with Macbook Pro 13 inch 2017
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was looking for a charger to that was powerful enough to charge my IPad Pro 12.9 inch and my MacBook Pro 13 inch both 2017 models. This charger works well and charges my MacBook Pro at a seemingly decent speed. I took off one star because of the price. It is very expensive and most people are not going to pay that much for this.
customer_reviews.author: Essence

customer_reviews.title: I believe I got a defective one/ “update January 15, 2019”
customer_reviews.text: My first experience wasn’t great but I must say that anker customer service reached out and took care of the problem. They sent a replacement and I must say, this is the quality I’ve come to expect from anker. The battery charges my MacBook Pro 13inch 2017 at a fast rate. Mostly the unit recharged in 4 hours with the supplied charger. I’m pleased with the product but I’m well pleased with the customer services. I’ve always and will continue to buy Anker
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great product/Wonderful customer service
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Anker products for a few years and have been very happy with both products I've owned (the 26800 PD being the latter of the two). I haven't written a review on the products themselves, because they both already have pretty great ratings/reviews. That bein said, I recently had a hardware malfunction on the charging adapter after owning the 26800 PD for almost a year. I worked with one of their customer service reps, and she guided me through the entire process; touching base with me every step of the way. In the end, I now have a working adapter and I can't speak highly enough about the service that was provided to me. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan B

customer_reviews.title: A Travel Necessity
customer_reviews.text: I travel internationally a few times a year for work, and am often using my Macbook or even just my Nintendo Switch in the airport or wherever to make a 4 hour layover go by, or get some quick work done. This makes doing that flawless. I have my series of international adapters, and we've all done the Airport outlet search, but this has enough battery life that no matter what I do on my flight everything will simply keep working till I get to my hotel and can recharge. Not the lightest thing around, but its got a massive capacity. Very well built though.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Albanese

customer_reviews.title: WORK OUTSIDE!
customer_reviews.text: Hey! Are you sick of staying inside? I think we all are. As most of us are transitioning into working from home; now that its sunny out we can have a little more freedom...but you'll need to keep designing and working right? Well now there's enough power to do that for hours with this product. I used to have a phone charger that was smaller from this brand that even though technology keeps evolving, held a strong charge and was SO DURABLE. I've invested in this laptop version and so far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: The built quality is very good due to the metal body and it is PD ...
customer_reviews.text: The built quality is very good due to the metal body and it is PD support so it fast charge my iOS devices
customer_reviews.author: kelvin

customer_reviews.title: Great product for mobile switch users and many more.
customer_reviews.text: Huge powerbank, fast charging. outpaces the battery decay on my switch on max brightness, which is what I was hoping for. It's a little wider and heavier than my Anker 20,000 MAh bank which is to be expected, but the mesh carrying bag is far looser, likely to also carry the included charger. I personally wish this were not the case, as I'm more likely to put the charger elsewhere and would prefer a more size appropriate holder for the bank itself. Since that insignificant complaint is the only one I have, 5 stars to Anker for another amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for home use too
customer_reviews.text: The fast charging for Android devices using USB C is remarkable. Not only has this been a workhorse for travel, but I find I use it at home all the time too for when I want to charge my device sitting in bed or on the sofa without having to go find an adapter and run it to the wall. It's great because it charges my phone very quickly, just like it was plugged into the wall. I had it with me at Disney World in a very long line, and I wound up charging not only my phone but that of my friends and several people we met in line (we were there for hours!).
customer_reviews.author: anoddexperiment

customer_reviews.title: Awesome battery, really nice fast charger.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing battery for juicing up literally any device on the go. However... Not exactly light weight. Probably not worth carrying for long distance backpackers, etc. I'm about to go to London and Paris and will be walking virtually everywhere and we'll see how sick I get of toting this around in my backpack. Will definitely be worth having on the 14 hour flight though!
customer_reviews.author: ghepting

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional
customer_reviews.text: As I've come to expect with nearly all Anker products that I own, this is an exceptional item. I own several Anker batteries and I didn't NEED this one, but as my world moves further into USB-C, I decided to upgrade to this. Its very convenient that the same cable that is used to charge this battery, I can also use to charge my phone and tablet without unplugging the cable from the unit. It also itself recharges, and charges your other devices very quickly as you would expect with the USB-C standard. It's an absolute must have when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect but one small thing
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect if you are traveling a long distance or on the go. One Problem: The battery specification text that says the size of the battery can't be read very easily by AirPort staff. It took two TSA and One cop to come read the battery details to make sure it could come on a plane. The cop had to take his glasses off and have a TSA member use them to read it.
customer_reviews.author: iOwner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, best I have got so far
customer_reviews.text: We're always traveling or camping and this is the best charger I have bought so far, it is a little heavy but other than that, with a full charge I was able to charge for 2 days 3 Cell phones 100% in a very small amount of time, I'm talking taht I could take my phone from 24% to 100% in less than an hour during our visit to Disney, and then my sons were charging theirs all the time without having to re-charge this power bank. I would recommend it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent MacBook Air Companion with a Few Quirks
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is perfect for keeping my MacBook Air (2018 model) and other devices charged while traveling. Between the MacBook Air's long battery life and this in my bag, I'm essentially free from the need to find a place at the airport / hotel lobby / customer site / restaurant / wherever next to a plug to charge my laptop, phone, and tablet. I only have one (rather minor) complaint about this battery - it doesn't seem to charge when I plug it in using the MacBook Air's power supply. Luckily, I can charge my MacBook Air with the power supply from this battery, which helps cut down on travel weight. All in all, an excellent device.
customer_reviews.author: PoliSciNerd

customer_reviews.title: Well built.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to take on deployment with me. I was expecting it to be bigger than my old pack. However the weight did catch me a little off guard. This thing is a beast. I have a Samsung S10+ and it works perfectly with it. The phone charges both from the standard USB port and the USB C port without any issues. I can get 50% charge off of it in under and hour. I'm very glad I purchased this. also the 30W PD charger that comes with it works well with Anker PowerWave 15 Pad (wireless charger) I purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works for Switch, Phones, Headphones. Great for travel.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a portable battery for the Switch, This is your brick! Delivers at full PD charge standard. The included charger will also charge your switch. I'be been using this for a few weeks now, it will even work with my hdmi adapter. It's rated at around 96 Watt Hours, which is perfectly safe under the flight limit of 100Wh. I haven't been stopped for it yet. Though I do suggest bringing around the little manual pamphlet just in case they ask. It is on the heavy side, so it may not be great as a daily unless you are using it for multiple devices like your phone, headphones, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Welcome To The Jungle

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for travel to Europe and to keep my iPhone Xs charged so I could watch movies all the way. No problem whatsoever. I often use it at home if sitting on the couch watching TV and the phone battery is low. I am so pleased with how quickly it charges. Plus it is so small and light weight. Easily fits in my purse or back pocket. I liked it so much I bought a second one and keep both charged in the event of a California wildfire and loss of power.
customer_reviews.author: O-L-S

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working, got a replacement through warranty
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: 9/5/18 Anker's customer service reps actually got back to me and asked me for some details. They sent me a replacement which is working perfectly. This is the thing with actual known brands- their customer service is actually good. (It's simply not charging any longer. Loved it while it worked but what is the point if I have to buy multiple. They're not exactly cheap throwaway batteries.)
customer_reviews.author: Noe Alavez

customer_reviews.title: Anker has great customer assistance
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5-stars because: It's made by Anker. It has USB-C PD. It includes the wall adapter. Anker has great customer assistance. It was on sale at Amazon on the day I purchased it and it just works. I will be using it to charge my 2016 MacBook Pro, 12.9" iPad and iPhone 8 whenever I am on the road. I recently took it on a flight and TSA did take it out of my laptop bag to examine it at security (I have TSA PreCheck) but quickly let me pass - no questions asked. This is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gene G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few weeks and I am impressed with this product. The portable charger is stylish, a little big but it has its benefits. I liked the power adapter a lot as well. Together, they make a complete travel companion. The battery is 26800 mAh. Its huge. It can easily charge my iPhone for 6-7 times. Works with my 13 inch macbook as well. I highly recommend this product. Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: Khaled Mosharraf Mukut

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great Until USB-C Port Failed
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed using my Anker PowerCore 26800 PD to keep my MacBook Pro, iPad, and iPhone charged on long haul flights for the first 5 weeks of owning it. That is, until the USB-C port stopped working. Without the USB-C port, I cannot recharge the device so now I am stuck with a big black paper weight that does not work. I am now out of my return period with Amazon and Anker email warranty support is atrociously slow and have now gone unresponsive now that they know they need to replace the unit. I will try the RAVPower unit at a 1/3 of the price next time.
customer_reviews.author: Russell C.

customer_reviews.title: Best battery ever.
customer_reviews.text: Since getting a very powerful charger reduces the battery lifetime of my Surface Go in the long term, but I still wanted to have some battery left no matter what. I ended up buying this PowerBank with the 30W charger because there was a sale, they drop it from $130 to around $89. The battery it's slightly heavy but it charges anything quickly and without getting those items warm, at least not so much. It's just the king the productivity. 9.9/10 just because it's slightly heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Ramses Marin

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service. Long battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Customer service contacted me and I received a replacement that is fully charging. Thank you so much! The original product that ordered back in June was only able to charge to 50%, and would not charge anymore after I had depleted the battery on a hike. The battery holds a lot of juice. I recommend putting it through a trial of depleting it (i.e. charge an iPad or something from it for awhile) and then recharging it to ensure that it holds a charge before you go on a hike or something where you are going to want to depend on it.
customer_reviews.author: abacuscode

customer_reviews.title: Portal Power!
customer_reviews.text: Love this battery bank! using it daily/weekly. The main purpose was for our Eupore trip and keeping the Nintendo Switch charged, but ended up using daily (and charging every few days) to keep cellphones charged (too many video & photos were taken, plus map/GPS and Google Searches... no phone calls, just IM/Text) Now we charge it once a week and use it to charge the cellphones and Tablet, instead using electricity on "peak time". Had no problems charging 3 devices at once and no you cannot charge the bank and a device at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Fredericka N Thompson

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great, a massive battery. Unfortunately, it barely lasted one charge with my Macbook and for the weight is hard to make it worth traveling with such performance. Hoping these things continue to improve! UPDATE: The company reached out and suggested I try a replacement. I'm glad they did because this new one works very well, has exactly the juice I need to keep using this daily when running from meeting to meeting.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Update :  good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for one month and now will not charge or be charged. I’m past the return date but will try to get it replaced. Update: customer service contacted me and replaced my original unit at no cost. The new unit appears to be working as it should. Would give 5 stars but for the hassle of getting a bad unit. Again, when it works, I love it. I keep two iPhones charged for a week before I have to recharge this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Carney

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing! It's basically portable wall power if you have ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! It's basically portable wall power if you have a Type-C device. It can charge my phone faster than the charger it came with, and can charge plenty of other stuff as the same time. The Type-C PD port also allows this to charge much faster than any other battery pack I've had previously. It takes charging this thing from a day-long affair to just a few hours. Worth the cost if you want the capacity and the speed of charging.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Schlickenmaier

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this battery pack for two years, using it about 3-4 times per year. On my last trip it stopped charging with no warning, leaving me in a bind. Anker support declared it defective, but out of warranty (18 months), so I'm out of luck. At the time I was ok paying a premium for the Anker brand, but feel I did not get a quality product. In the future I'll probably go with a cheaper one so I won't feel cheated if it dies after 2 years of light use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Beckman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 7 months but Anker delivered
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great, although it is a tad heavy, but it just stopped taking a charge. For the money spent, this is ridiculous. I'm revising review to 5 stars because company responded immediately to inquiry and after having me test the product a couple ways, they sent me a replacement within 2 days. If they stand behind their product like that, I'll continue supporting them.
customer_reviews.author: atgreek

customer_reviews.title: Great product and support!
customer_reviews.text: This device has been a life saver for trips where I need my phone or my girlfriend constantly kills her phone multiple times. The USB C charging works perfectly for our Pixel phones and her MacBook Pro (mostly just holds it's battery level). I had a minor issue on my own behalf with the USB C port being tilted over repeated use and the team at Anker was nice enough to help fix the battery. Not only do I recommend the product but hold the highest regard for their support team.
customer_reviews.author: theLazyFrodo

customer_reviews.title: Super Solid Portable Battery
customer_reviews.text: Been a big fan of Anker products for some time. Was looking for something to power my 2019 macbook pro while working on the go. This will power my laptop fully with no battery use for 2.5-4+ hours depending on energy demands. I often use my iphone as a wifihotspot and it works great. Charges fast, mostly charged in about 2 hours. Relatively small and lightweight for the battery capacity. I had one that start to lose some of its oopmh after about six months - submitted a warranty claim through Anker's website and had a new one within a few days which works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel B.

customer_reviews.title: Would not charge Dell Tablet PC that requires 27W USB-C PD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this powerbank to keep a Dell Tablet PC operational throughout a 10hr workshift without charging, it will not charge the tablet. Upon arrival of the PowerCore+ I plugged the powerbank into the tablet and it said it was charging slowly. After charging the powerbank overnight everytime I plugged it in I got a notice that the PC wasn't charging. Returning to buy a unit with 45W output so that there is some wattage overhead instead of expecting a 30W powerbank to to supply 27W. It did charge a USB-C phone fast as well as quickly charging another powerbank and a iPhone at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Best PD powerbank !
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, if you do not intend to use USB C to USB C cables or power delivery to charge your devices this powerbank will be of no use to you. Would be better to get the version with quick charge. I use this to charge me USB C devices using a PD cable, my iPad Pro 10.5 with a C to lighting cable and also my MacBook Pro as well. Many cheaper options out and they do not work as well, I've tried ravpower and Aukey, Anker has the highest usable capacity. Very solid build quality and heavy too. Suitable for power users like me that requires a single powersource to keep all my devices topped up.
customer_reviews.author: Ming Jun

customer_reviews.title: Battery tank
customer_reviews.text: I've had several anker chargers and wires all have lasted me relatively long for their price I still have my previous anker but decided to upgrade when I saw this one on sale and for the faster recharge on the bank itself if you need something for heavy duty use that you don't want to worry about dropping or babying this is it and with the large capacity you're set for pretty much any emergency getting at least 4-5 full charges
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: First off yes, my first one did die on me, it stopped charging. However, Anker customer support went above and beyond to get me a replacement unit in a very fast manner. Not only did I get a new battery pack but they sent me a new one, not a refurbished unit. Complete with a new charger and USB-C cord! Thanks Anker for the great products and service!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Charged and ready to travel!
customer_reviews.text: If you have ever been in an airport your know that finding an available charging station is sometimes hard to come. It's also hard to find one that hugs your plug for efficient charging. Well this is a great device. Its got 2 USB ports and 1 USB type C for my Apple devices. It charges easily and charges devices quick enough and fully. Great for travel. I've used Anker products before and they are safe and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: LWT

customer_reviews.title: Charging this charger is way quicker than the rest of the 26800 series!!!
customer_reviews.text: Its just great, had just the simple 26800 charger of anker, sold one...then thought about getting (2) of these bad boys!!! They were delivered with 30% charge so I charged them right out of the box, both charged between 4-5hrs. And thou they say full charge is 4.5hrs., I'm still happy because the regular 26800 charger & 26800 powercore +, took like 12hrs. to charge!!! Yep 12HRS!!! SO I'M HAPPY with this product, they should have had this from the beginning, the price is huge...but if it lasts a long time...its surely worth it then!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kiambu

customer_reviews.title: Anker has made another great product again
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase so far. I’ve read the reviews about this particular powerbank acting up and not charging correctly or not at all. I went from a 10,000 mAh to this beast. Anker makes quality products. Pros: Lots of mAh, will last you a very long time. The battery Anker uses are similar to the batteries found in Tesla’s so they are reliable. 18 month warranty Comes with a charger. Quality feel of the powerbank, I think it’s aluminum and not plastic for the shell. Cons: No longer portable as it is massive, but might be a benefit for others.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: Best USB PD Bank on the Market
customer_reviews.text: There's virtually nothing to dislike about this except for the price. The Device both charges and can be charged with USB PD. It is quite and heavy large for a power bank, and won't make it even in large pockets, but does great in a bag or pack with a long cable. the body is solid aluminum and feels pretty tough, but given its weight a drop would be damaging. I got this on a flash sale for $88 and at that price its a steal. at 130, you have to do you own cost/benefit analysis. but if you want a singular charger for the long haul. this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best products that I have ever owned. I have taken it on a couple of international trips, and it will keep your phone and tablet charged for days without having to mess around with the plug converters, etc. It also acts as a backup battery for my MacBook Pro, and the power brick will work directly to charge the MacBook Pro, so when you travel, you only need to bring with one power brick and USB-C cord. The unit is elegant, durable, and fits nicely in any carryon luggage. It's a bit heavy, but given the massive power storage, that is expected.
customer_reviews.author: Home Theater Guy

customer_reviews.title: VERY heavy unit, allowing for good backup charge, but flawed at showing level of own charge
customer_reviews.text: Leaving this charger to charge the iPad delpeated the batteries in one night, with no warning leaving me with a bricked “brick” the next day. Battery charge indicators on the on/off button are subtle and may be hard to see, even in a dark hotel room (especially at an angle) leading to one falsely thinking the unit is charged when in fact it isn’t. Please be aware that this unit is EXTREMELY heavy, and is NOT suitable for carrying around in jeans pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Ashi Fachler

customer_reviews.title: FANTASMIC
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the description, all i know is that I bought a cheaper Anker and when the cheaper version was hooked up to my Mackbook, it merely slowed down the rate of discharge. HOWEVER, this is my 2nd 26800PD (some bastard stole the first one) and I couldn't be happier. It lasts a long time and it actually increases the charge on my Macbook. At 1.3 lbs its a little hefty, but heh, what do you expect?
customer_reviews.author: Pete Pasquale

customer_reviews.title: The best power bank I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: The power bank was larger than I had expected but I am able to charge my iPad Pro 10.5 twice! The charge speed with a USB C to lightning cable is fantastic. The included charger charges my iPad and power bank very quickly. I am glad I skipped buying an Apple brand as fast charge worked flawlessly with my iPad and iPhone! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fourth one i purchase
customer_reviews.text: I should have learnt by now. I was actually given a replacement by Anker for the first one.. it came dead out the box brand new. I didnt feel like sending in the second one that messed up within 3 months because how many little dents it got from being like 5 pounds. So i ordered another one because when they work its nice to have charge your phone for 3 days straight. Unless they offer to replace all 4 of the these i have im sticking to this review of 1/5. They were not even abused i only used them in my house and car throughout a year.
customer_reviews.author: Jr

customer_reviews.title: Tons of battery life and fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Powercore+ for over 7 months and it has been a great companion when traveling with my MacBook and iPhone. I did have a problem with the device refusing to charge and Anker’s support was fantastic. They immediately sent me a label to send the defective battery back, and I received the replacement in a couple days. I am very happy with the customer service I received, and the new replacement works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: jstaff

customer_reviews.title: If you travel and need to charge your electronics
customer_reviews.text: So I spent a lot of last year traveling to friends and family and this guy is great for charging my phone and my switch. It never fully drained after one charge to full and continual use over a month and letting it sit. I checked the status after letting it sit for a month with no use and then charged my devices with it over the course of two days and it dropped to 40% charge left. It is sturdy and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly bulky and heavy. The Mophie XXL is a better choice
customer_reviews.text: I have one. It’s well-made and it works, but I bought a Mophie XXL 20,000 mAh with USB-C PD afterwards and that’s what I actually carry with me. The Mophie is more expensive, has slightly lower capacity, and a plastic rather than metal case. It is also much lighter and more compact, supports priority pass through charging, and its textile cover means no case required.
customer_reviews.author: Fazal Majid

customer_reviews.title: Best portable battery in my Pinyan
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to be too passionate or descriptive about batteries but I’ve always been a fan of anchor I’ve had their lipstick battery and decided I needed something bigger especially to charge my MacBook or Nintendo switch or my oculus go so I needed something I could work with all three and also affect the voltage amount adequately this one does it charge is relatively fast for size and it dispenses quickly and chargers my multiple items with peace and comfort I would highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice to have around.
customer_reviews.text: Great combination for travel. I don't fly alot so being under the FAA requirements for size doesn't really matter but anything bigger than this would be unnecessary. The battery is heavy and cold. Definitely not cheap feeling. The carrying bag is a little goofy but you don't have to use it and everything else in the the box is exceptional. I would definitely recommend this, especially if you can get it on sale.
customer_reviews.author: J.L. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Charges the 15 inch MacBookPro FAST.
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. I have the larger MacBook Pro with touch bar and it keeps it charge while I'm working ... I've tried three other USB-C chargers and all they do is help the battery drain a little more slowly ... helpful, but not super helpful ... Easily the best USB-C battery I've used... It's refreshing for something to work as advertised ...
customer_reviews.author: Matt McGill

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service+++
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I felt compelled to after the great customer service I received. I've been using this battery for about 5 months and the mesh pouch it came with was at the end of it's life. I emailed Anker asking if I could purchase another mesh pouch because I liked the protection from it, and they sent me one at no charge. Battery still works awesome, every penny well spent. They got a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use this a lot and after about 16 months it stopped charging. I could no longer charge it. I tried several different cables and charges and it was dead. Given the lifespan of this, it wasn't worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Junkie

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend doing it over night
customer_reviews.text: This portable charger was fundamental in our getting around Asia. It's a bit of a bulky item, but that's to be expected with the capacity that this thing has. If you're needing to charge it, I'd recommend doing it over night, since depending on current capacity, it will take some time. We were able to travel for 10 days, charging 2 phones multiple times a day while only have to recharge the the power bank once. I'd highly recommend this product to travelers, or anyone that frequently burns through portable device batteries easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ben McClelland

customer_reviews.title: 15" MacBook Pro -- 2019
customer_reviews.text: This battery pack powers my MacBook Pro (15-inch, 2019) for almost 3 hours. The battery is barely touched at the end of 2.5 hours (started at 100%, it now shows 99%), while the Anker power pack shows about 20% remaining. This pack gives me the freedom to work at a café where outlets may not be readily available. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hashimoto

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability. Usb c port died in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Utter and complete garbage. Died on me on third month. Won't charge my mbp. The usb c socket is really poor quality. Never anker again. Edit :The customer support emailed me without me doing anything. They refunded me the full amount and didn't even ask for the product back. I'm giving it a 4 star now. 3 additional stars for their great customer service. 1 star off for this unpleasant experience for such an expensive item.
customer_reviews.author: Kandrakar

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic power bank!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a backup power source for traveling, havent gotten to put it on a plane or travel with it, but its charging ability and speed is something I keep in the car and use instead of plugging it into the car. I easily get 8+ full charges on an iphone. I havent used it to power a laptop yet, but this battery pack definitely packs a punch. Keep an eye out for deals because I got this as one of amazons deals of the days for around $70 bucks. Completely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Customer care
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great customer service. Bought this and used this for about seven months and it didn't want to charge anymore. I wasn't sure if anker would solve my problem because usually customer service will give me excuses not to help my fix it or replace. Emailed anker customer service and they responded very fast and helped me solve my problem. They actually send me a new one after I send them the defective portable charger. Overall very satisfied with the product and the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: Solid battery, faulty USB port
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this about a year and a half and it’s been great. My only issue is that about six months ago, one of the USB ports stopped working which means I can only charge one USB-A and one USB-C item at a time. More often than not, I’d use both USB-A ports to charge my things since that’s what the majority of my charging cables use.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Not good for pacemakers, but good for mobile devices
customer_reviews.text: Do you find yourself playing video games more than an arms length away from an outlet but goued to your chair because you're lazy like me? Do you find your tablet phone and switch are all dying simultaneously because you cant just play final fantasy on your switch but must also play Bloons on your tablet and scrabble on your phone? Well this Anker is for you! It has plenty of charging ports last well and is powerful enough to charge up your devices like switch from the brink of death to full charge while playing multiple times in one cycle. Def worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Meika

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of reserve power for all the devices.
customer_reviews.text: This thing takes forever to charge..... and even longer to drain. Paired it with the matching Hermitshell case and it's great on the go. Makes the backpack a bit heavy though. Charges the Switch, phone, kindle, watch, wireless baby monitor (this is so nice), etc. I use this instead of bringing a dozen chargers with when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ross

customer_reviews.title: Charges 15" MacBook, iPad Pro, and iPhones with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Charges my 15" Macbook Pro, which surprised me! This, plus its included power brick, is the only charger I bring with me when traveling, with my iPad, my iPhone, and my Macbook Pro. It fits my needs perfectly. If you need to charge FAST or you do a lot of heavy lifting on your Mac, you may want your 87W adapter that the computer came with, but if you use your computer fairly lightly as I do, or have good downtime between sessions, this is just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ZigZag

customer_reviews.title: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
customer_reviews.text: I was able to purchase it with an additional discount last December 2018. It is quite heavy, but I get 4 (10%-100%) charges on my Switch or about 6 full charges on my S9 before I have to recharge the power bank. This also fits the Satisfye Pro Elite case slot perfectly. I have been using it for a month now and it's the perfect addition to my gadget/travel arsenal. Will buy another one when it goes on sale again.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Bongsky

customer_reviews.title: Great battery charger
customer_reviews.text: I love the Anker battery charger. I did have one that I had to go through the warranty for the charging port, but it was an easy process and they replaced it without question. This battery has a large capacity and works well to keep my note 9 and my 11 inch iPad pro charged. The PD charger with it charged the battery as described in around 4 hours. I would buy it again if I needed another.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S Ady

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Battery
customer_reviews.text: Arrived just in time for my vacation to Kauai. So I got it all charged up and ready, knowing I would be depending on it to keep my phone alive while hiking through forest and beach going... Then found out the hard way that the damn thing doesn't even charge. It says it's at max capacity when it's plugged in charging, but soon as you disconnect it from the wall and try to charge something else, it dies.
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: It charges my Macbook Pro!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Powers all my devices when I run low or forget to charge the night before. It is SUPER quick to charge back up compared to the other power banks I have tried too. BONUS! It charges my Macbook Pro! I am thrilled I don't have to lug around my big cord and have the opportunity to streamline my bag. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Katie D.

customer_reviews.title: Great If You Need To Do A Lot Of Charging In One Day
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the biggest issue with this device is that whether you use it or not it will completely discharge in ~1-2 days, which isn't the type of quality I'd expect from such an expensive product. So if you plan to have a day of traveling it is great to keep all your devices charged for that day. However if you want to have it on hand for a quick charge every so often, you wont be able to depend on this device to hold the same amount of charge you last left it with.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Battery died - but GREAT customer service saved the day!
customer_reviews.text: My battery died after 9 months. I looked and realized it had 18 month warranty so I reached out to Anker. I got a FAST response from Anker representative Alicia Liu requesting some additional information. Once I sent that they sent a replacement battery immediately and I got it in 3 days. I had outstanding, personalized customer service from Ms. Liu. Products break from time to time, but superior customer service like this is rare today. Anker now has a dedicated customer in me!
customer_reviews.author: GeneralChang

customer_reviews.title: PowerCore+ 26800 PD not re-charging
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the subject PowerCore just a little over a month ago, performed a full charge. Used the PowerCore to power a couple of cell phones and my iPad Pro, PowerCore worked flawlessly. Issue is now it's time to recharge the unit and that's not happening, will only charge to 3 lights after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great charger. Weak cable
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Lasts a really long time. The supplied USB-C cable though is not rated very highly. Kept disconnecting and reconnecting when charging my laptop (HP x360 Spectre 2019). Purchased a 100w rated cable and it charges fine. Another $15-20 for what should have been a decent cable to begin with. Still a great device though.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: The best of the best
customer_reviews.text: Anker does it again, this thing is a beast. I can quick charge my phone so many times without having to recharge my battery bank. I can get around 3.5 to 4 charges on my Nintendo switch, so I'm not complaining. Its a bit on the heavy side, but it doesn't bother me because I invested in a carrying case. Also it holds a good charge while not in use..
customer_reviews.author: Keylo

product_meta.title: Anker PowerCore+ 26800 PD with 30W Power Delivery Charger, Portable Charger Bundle for MacBook Air / iPad Pro 2018, iPhone 11 / 11 Pro / 11 Pro Max / XS / X, S10, and USB C Laptops with Power Delivery
feature_bullets: The Anker Advantage: Join the 50 million+ powered by America's leading USB charging brand.
Huge Charging Power: high-speed charging for phones, tablets and USB-C notebooks. Boasts 1 USB-C (30W) and 2 USB ports (5V/3a each).
Colossal capacity: 26800mAh of power charges most phones over 7 times, tablets at least 2 times or notebooks at least once.
Recharge 3X faster: time for a full recharge is reduced to 4. 5 hours thanks to Power delivery input (27W). Compatible charger included.

What you get: Power core+ 26800 PD, 30W USB-C wall charger, Micro USB cable, USB-C to USB-C cable (Lightning cable not included), travel pouch, welcome guide, our worry-free 18-month and friendly customer service.
